description: Computer agent for the qualitative modeling and simulation of genetic regulatory networks. It assists you in constructing a model of a genetic regulatory network using knowledge about regulatory interactions in combination with gene expression data. Moreover, it allows you to simulate the qualitative behavior of the network in response to external perturbations.
name: GNA

metadata.abstract: Genetic Network Analyzer (GNA) is a agent for the qualitative modeling and simulation of gene regulatory networks, based on so-called piecewise-linear differential equation models. We describe the use of this agent in the context of the modeling of bacterial regulatory networks, notably the network of global regulators controlling the adaptation of Escherichia coli to carbon starvation conditions. We show how the modeler, by means of GNA, can define a regulatory network, build a model of the network, determine the steady states of the system, perform a qualitative simulation of the network dynamics, and analyze the simulation results using model-checking agents. The example illustrates the interest of qualitative approaches for the analysis of the dynamics of bacterial regulatory networks. Â© 2012 Springer Science+Business Media, LLC.
metadata.title: Genetic network analyzer: A agent for the qualitative modeling and simulation of bacterial regulatory networks
